intro: Dortmanna trigona, commonly known as the three-angled dock, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible parts. The plant features triangular, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a rough texture. It produces small, greenish flowers arranged in dense clusters, and its roots are sometimes used in traditional medicine. Dortmanna trigona is typically found in moist soils along streambanks and in damp woodlands.
